security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure prompt-based documentation file with no executable code. It describes disaster recovery operations but contains no scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. The skill defines MCP tool interfaces for backup and recovery operations.

content.user_title: Manage Proxmox backups and disaster recovery
content.value_statement: Protect your Proxmox infrastructure from data loss. This skill automates backup creation, restores VMs and containers from backups, and helps you test recovery procedures before disaster strikes.
actual_capabilities: Create VM and container backups in Proxmox
Restore VMs and containers from existing backups
Create and manage snapshots for point-in-time recovery
Monitor backup status and storage usage
Plan and test disaster recovery procedures
Generate backup reports and compliance documentation
limitations: Requires Proxmox VE environment with MCP tools configured
Cannot perform backups without proper storage configuration
Recovery time depends on storage performance and backup size
Cannot access cloud backup services directly

use_cases.title: Automate backup workflows
use_cases.description: Schedule and manage backups for multiple VMs and containers across your Proxmox cluster

use_cases.title: Test recovery procedures
use_cases.description: Verify backup integrity and practice recovery steps before real emergencies occur

use_cases.title: Generate compliance reports
use_cases.description: Create audit-ready documentation of backup status and disaster recovery readiness

prompt_templates.title: Create backup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a backup of VM {vm_id} to storage location {storage_name}

prompt_templates.title: Check status
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the status of all backups created in the last 7 days

prompt_templates.title: Restore VM
prompt_templates.prompt: Restore VM {vm_id} from the backup created on {date}

prompt_templates.title: Disaster report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a disaster recovery test report for all critical VMs

output_examples.input: Create a backup of VM 100 and show me available storage
output: Recommendation: Consider offsite replication for critical data

best_practices: Follow the 3-2-1 backup rule: 3 copies, 2 media types, 1 offsite
Test restore procedures regularly to verify backup integrity
Schedule backups during low-activity periods to minimize impact
anti_patterns: Storing all backups on the same storage pool as production
Ignoring backup failure alerts without investigation

faq.question: What Proxmox versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Proxmox VE 7.x and 8.x versions with MCP server configured

faq.question: How many backups can this skill manage?
faq.answer: No strict limit. Manages all backups defined in your Proxmox storage configuration

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with cloud storage?
faq.answer: Direct cloud integration requires additional MCP tools. Backups work with any Proxmox-supported storage

faq.question: Is my backup data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. All operations stay within your Proxmox environment. No data leaves your infrastructure

faq.question: What if a backup fails?
faq.answer: The skill reports failure details including error codes. Check storage capacity and Proxmox logs for troubleshooting

faq.question: How does this compare to Proxmox built-in backup?
faq.answer: This skill wraps Proxmox backup tools with natural language interface for easier management and automation
